articles.author: Blake Brittain
articles.description: A work of art created by artificial intelligence without any human input cannot be copyrighted under U.S. law, a U.S. court in Washington, D.C., has ruled.
articles.title: AI-generated art cannot receive copyrights, US court says

articles.author: Caroline Valetkevitch
articles.description: The Nasdaq was up more than 1% on Monday, and S&P 500 was also higher in afternoon trading, with shares of Nvidia jumping more than 6% as investors were optimistic ahead of its earnings due late on Wednesday.
articles.title: Nasdaq gains more than 1% as Nvidia jumps; investors await Jackson Hole meet

articles.author: Jonathan Stempel
articles.description: Wells Fargo (WFC.N) won the dismissal of a lawsuit accusing the fourth-largest U.S. bank of defrauding shareholders by touting its commitment to hiring diversity while its managers were conducting sham interviews of non-white and female job candidates.
articles.title: Wells Fargo defeats shareholder lawsuit over fake job interviews

articles.author: Saeed Azhar
articles.description: Goldman Sachs (GS.N) is weighing the sale of a part of its wealth business, it said on Monday, as it shifts its focus back to serving the ultra-rich and away from high-net-worth clients in mass markets.
articles.title: Goldman Sachs weighs sale of part of its wealth business

articles.author: Clare Baldwin, Katherine Masters
articles.description: Walmart and Centric Brands are investigating their supply chains in Cambodia over allegations that inmates at the country's largest women's prison were illegally employed to produce garments for export, following questions posed by Reuters and inquiries from a U.S. industry group about labour practices there.
articles.title: Exclusive: Walmart, Centric probe suppliers for potential links to Cambodia women's prison

articles.author: Dietrich Knauth
articles.description: The Roman Catholic Archdiocese of San Francisco filed for bankruptcy on Monday, saying a Chapter 11 filing will facilitate a settlement of about 500 lawsuits accusing the church of enabling childhood sexual abuse by priests.
articles.title: San Francisco Archdiocese files for bankruptcy to pursue sex abuse settlement

articles.author: Hannah Lang
articles.description: PayPal's (PYPL.O) stablecoin is likely to succeed where Facebook's failed, thanks to the payment giant's standing in Washington and policymakers' greater understanding of the issues in the last three years.
articles.title: Analysis: Why PayPal's stablecoin is likely to succeed where Facebook's Libra failed

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The first tropical storm to hit Los Angeles in more than 80 years unleashed floods across parts of Southern California more accustomed to drought, as officials urged the public to stay safe as they began to count the cost of damage.
articles.title: Tropical Storm Hilary releases fury on Southern  California

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia said on Monday a decision by Denmark and the Netherlands to donate the first F-16 fighter jets to Ukraine would only escalate the conflict, while Ukraine said the jets would help end Moscow's invasion.
articles.title: Russia says F-16s will escalate Ukraine war; Kyiv says they will tip the balance in its favour

articles.author: Michael Holden
articles.description: Nurse Lucy Letby will spend the rest of her life behind bars for killing seven newborn babies after a judge on Monday ruled Britain's most prolific serial child killer of modern times should never be released.
articles.title: Lucy Letby: killer nurse jailed for rest of her life by UK court
